Angel.Action: Engages in planning the performance, suggesting to play one of Omar's songs and then two songs including one of her own.
Points and gestures during rehearsal to communicate and coordinate with Omar.
Does not assertively lead or demonstrate clear authority in the rehearsal scene, relying on Omar's responses.
Starts to sing confidently on stage, maintains focus despite Omar's retreating presence and shadow in the spotlight.
Reacts to changes and continues performance seamlessly with added percussion and drums.
Leaves abruptly without explanation, creating uncertainty among others.
Is suggested by others as a talented singer worth collaborating with, indicating recognized skill.
Expresses trust in Omar despite him messing things up, shows emotional openness by saying 'I trusted you, you jerk!'
Holds hands with Omar, indicating connection and reconciliation.
Acknowledges Omar's feelings and reciprocates desire for 'everything' but cautions 'It takes time'
Confronts Omar directly but without hostility, seeks understanding
Expresses frustration and distrust toward Omar, showing awareness of mistakes made ('I trusted you, you jerk!')
Initiates reconnection by holding hands with Omar and engaging in dialogue about their desires and mistakes
Acknowledges complexity and takes a patient stance ('It takes time......')
Shows some hesitation and uncertainty in dialogue ('Yeah... ah..know what you mean,')
Maintains composure in a threatening situation involving Sleazy and Omar, suggesting calm under pressure.
Non-reactive/passive during Sleazy's aggressive moves and intrusion into the car, indicating possible lack of direct intervention or assertiveness.
Encourages Omar to engage with an unknown person despite potential danger, displays confidence in social interaction.
Shoves Omar down and then falls forward herself, indicating possible lack of physical control or clumsiness.
Nervously tries to speak when arriving at the mansion ('We..we're here ta’..t'see...Mok.'), indicating hesitation and lack of confidence.
Present at the planned visit with others, showing some level of participation and engagement in the group's goal despite nervousness.
Responds to MOK's compliment with a small laugh and polite admiration for his album.
Appears somewhat hesitant and uncomfortable during the interaction with MOK (stammering and overlapping speech).
Expresses hope and belief in the group's potential coming together and achieving something good.
Holds onto a rose and softly utters 'Call it what you want... I... I believe in...'
Quiet, contemplative presence with gentle reactions to mysterious and possibly intimidating events.
Refuses Mok's offer, stating 'I couldn't leave them for anything.'
Breaks the vase in Mok's space, showing defiance and physical action to resist captivity.
Falls into the room but quickly stands and exits confidently, indicating readiness and control.
Turns to the camera and delivers a defiant statement against captors, showing assertiveness and presence of mind.
Acknowledges the difficulty of life despite a new relationship, showing a hint of vulnerability and sincerity.
Engages cooperatively in playful activity with Cindy (spring-boarding and sliding into ducts).
Responds to Cindy's comment with hesitation and uncertainty, saying 'Yeah....I....I..guess 50....but ah...hey..ah..it...does.. don't make life any easier.'
Steps to center couch confidently as part of the plan or action in the room.
Steps confidently onto the couch to be spring-boarded up into the duct, demonstrating physical coordination and confidence.
Enters crawling through the duct with purpose, showing skill and determination in navigating a difficult environment.
Uses humor and playful teasing towards Cindy, showing social confidence.
Does not actively intervene or assist Cindy when she falls, seeming passive or indifferent.
Leans in close, crawls carefully in tight spaces, showing physical control and awareness.
Vocal reactions like 'Whew!' and 'dOooph!' indicating surprise or minor mishaps.
Peering down intently in a dark duct, showing alertness but reacting in fear when discovered and silenced by Cindy, then withdrawing cautiously.
Leaves the band without telling anybody and runs off with Mok without saying goodbye.
Leaves the band without telling anybody and runs off with Mok without saying goodbye.
Paces while thinking, listens carefully to Mok’s offer but clearly refuses to sing or take the offered deal.
Stops and reacts quickly to Mok’s movements and words, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Firmly rejects the temptations of fame and riches, expressing clear personal boundaries and self-knowledge.
Does not appear to make a counteroffer or strategic plan immediately in response to Mok’s firm stance.
Shouts a warning to Mok to stop, indicating awareness and attempt to intervene.
Reacting emotionally by calling Mok 'totally crazy' after a dangerous action.
Calls out to multiple people confidently and promptly upon seeing them, demonstrating situational awareness and social engagement.
Reacts to Dizzy dropping her pants with a visible change in expression, showing awareness but no decisive action.
Remains present and attentive on the bus platform, maintaining engagement with group members but without initiating actions or solutions.
Promises Omar that he'll get him out of a bad situation.
Refers to some characters as 'airheads' in an overlapping voice.
Promises Omar to get him out of a difficult situation, showing commitment and leadership.
Expresses frustration about being forced by Mok to sing, showing limited control over the situation.
Plays a slow, romantic piano piece 'Send Love Thru' and expresses vulnerability by admitting 'I can't resist you... anymore' and asking 'Take me with you, wherever you go.'
Plays the piano skillfully and confidently, performing a slow romantic version of a song.
Expresses emotional vulnerability and inability to resist Mok, indicating momentary loss of control.
Kneels down and massages Mok's chest, expressing desire to cancel concert and be alone together.
Suggests to Mok to go away together, offers to let Mok choose the destination.
Insists she is the one with the voice and refuses to sink despite Mok's aggression.
Proposes to go away together, showing initiative and confidence in making decisions about plans.
States 'I'm the one with the voice' confidently, indicating self-assurance in her abilities.
Engages in a verbal exchange with Mok, standing her ground despite interruptions.
Calls Mok a fraud and a joke despite being physically choked and attacked.
Coughs and chokes, appears physically overwhelmed and does not effectively counterattack or escape.
Starts singing confidently on stage while complex laser and lighting effects are coordinated around her.
Maintains composure and focus during a technically demanding performance with intricate lighting and laser effects.
Encourages Omar to sing despite his hesitation, says 'Trust me.'
Decides confidently to sing despite Omar's hesitation, saying 'It's now Omar! I gotta sing!' and 'Trust me.'
Puts up her arms in defense as claws change shape into snake-like mouths, facing an immediate physical threat with awareness.
Stays present and sings calmly despite falling debris and danger around her, showing composure.
No visible attempt to escape or counterattack when large debris and ominous claws approach, seeming passive in a dangerous situation.
Reacts to the fall of Mok with Omar and sings in unison, maintaining composure during a chaotic event.
No direct intervention or attempt to rescue Mok from falling into the pentagram vortex.
